moves.9. Re1+ Be7 10. Qh5 O-O 11. Bxd5: The initial skirmish, removing Black's centralized Knight.
moves.11... cxd5 12. Nd2: After the exchange, I feel it's time to start developing my Q side.
moves.14... Bf6 15. Qf4: Still eyeing the Pawn on Black's Q5.
moves.15... Qb6 16. Qh6: Since Black evolved an adequate defense to my initial threat, I switch my target to the K side.
moves.18... a4 19. Nd2: This Knight will eventually swing to the K-side.
moves.19... Rfe8 20. b3: First I have to defend for a move or two.
moves.20... axb3 21. cxb3: I end the minor skirmish unscathed.
moves.21... Bf5 22. Qg3: Defending the Pawn, for the moment.
moves.22... Qb4 23. Nf3: It's going to fall, so I may as well go ahead and swing my Knight to the K side like I had intended.
moves.23... Bxd3 24. Red1: A quick little combo to equalize the material.
moves.26... Rad8 27. Ng5: Not only attacking the B, but also setting up a potential threat with the Q.
moves.27... Bf5 28. Qh4: Black can survive with 28... K-B1 or 28... P-R4.
moves.28... d4 29. Qxh7+: Now, however, mate will follow [29... K-B1 30 QxBP mate.] Black resigns.

opening: Ruy Lopez (C61), Bird's defence, Paulsen variation
